revised_title: Satellite Monitoring of the Ocean for Climate Research: A Review of the World Climate Research Programme
tldr: This article discusses the importance of satellite monitoring for studying the ocean and its role in climate research. It explains how satellite monitoring can help improve our understanding of the ocean's role in climate variation and how it can aid in predicting climate changes. The article also reviews the specifications for monitoring the ocean in the context of the World Climate Research Programme and describes the needs of major projects like WOCE and TOGA.
